name: Matt Moran
description: Matt Moran is a celebrity chef, restaurateur and media personality in Australia.

recipes.cooking_method: Use a sharp knife or scissors to remove silverskin and trim excess fat from tenderloin. Fold the thinner end under to approximate the thickness of the rest of the roast and tie with butcher's twine to secure. Tie tenderloin in 1 1/2- to 2-inch intervals to help it keep its shape during cooking
recipes.recipe_description: Juicy and tender grilled beef tenderloin seasoned with salt, pepper and olive oil.

ingredients: 1 large red chilli, deseeded and finely chopped
recipes.cooking_method: To make the dressing, mix 2 tbsp virtually fat-free fromage frais, the grated zest and juice of 2 limes and 2 tsp golden caster sugar in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.Cook 280g linguine pasta according to the packet instructions. Add 200g trimmed sugar snap peas for the last minute or so of cooking time
recipes.recipe_description: A classic Italian pasta dish with juicy prawns, linguine and a delicious tomato sauce.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 350°. In a large bowl, toss apples, brown sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt together. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, salt, and cinnamon. Add melted butter and stir until dough forms. Press mixture into a 10” or 11” tart pan with a removable bottom, pressing until dough is smooth.
recipes.recipe_description: A buttery and flaky crust filled with sweet and tender apples, cinnamon and sugar.

name: Adam Liaw
description: Adam liaw is an Australian cook, restaurateur and author.

ingredients: 3 carrots, halved and cut into chunks
recipes.cooking_method: Fry the onion and celery in 1 tbsp oil over a low heat until they start to soften – about 5 mins. Add the carrots, bay and thyme, fry for 2 mins, stir in the purée and Worcestershire sauce, add 600ml boiling water, stir and tip everything into a slow cooker. Crumble over the stock cubes or add the stock pots and stir, then season with pepper (don’t add salt as the stock may be salty)
recipes.recipe_description: Tender and succulent beef stew with root vegetables, red wine and beef stock.

ingredients: 1 large bunch fresh thyme, plus 20 sprigs
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.Remove the chicken giblets. Rinse the chicken inside and out. Remove any excess fat and leftover pin feathers and pat the outside dry. Liberally salt and pepper the inside of the chicken. Stuff the cavity with the bunch of thyme, both halves of lemon, and all the garlic. Brush the outside of the chicken with the butter and sprinkle again with salt and pepper. Tie the legs together with kitchen string and tuck the wing tips under the body of the chicken. Place the onions, carrots, and fennel in a roasting pan. Toss with salt, pepper, 20 sprigs of thyme, and olive oil. Spread around the bottom of the roasting pan and place the chicken on top.
recipes.recipe_description: A delicious and juicy roasted chicken seasoned with herbs and spices.

recipes.cooking_method: Heat oven to 150C/130C fan/gas 2.Using a pencil, mark out the circumference of a dinner plate on baking parchment.Whisk 4 egg whites with a hand mixer until they form stiff peaks, then whisk in 250g caster sugar, 1 tbsp at a time, until the meringue looks glossy.
recipes.recipe_description: A classic Australian dessert made with crispy meringue, whipped cream and fresh fruits.

name: Curtis Stone
description: Curtis Stone is an Australian celebrity chef, author and television personality.

ingredients: 4center-cut swordfish steaks, about 6 ounces each, one-inch thick
Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat a charcoal grill or broiler, or heat a grill pan.Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper on both sides. Place oil in a flat dish, and add soy sauce, vinegar, rosemary, garlic, coriander, cumin, lemon rind and pepper flakes. Blend well. Place fish steaks in marinade, coat well on both sides, cover with plastic wrap and let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.
recipes.recipe_description: This grilled swordfish is a quick and easy meal that is perfect for weeknight dinners. The fish is seasoned with lemon, garlic and herbs, and grilled to perfection.

ingredients: 1 large bunch fresh thyme, plus 20 sprigs
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.Remove the chicken giblets. Rinse the chicken inside and out. Remove any excess fat and leftover pin feathers and pat the outside dry. Liberally salt and pepper the inside of the chicken. Stuff the cavity with the bunch of thyme, both halves of lemon, and all the garlic. Brush the outside of the chicken with the butter and sprinkle again with salt and pepper. Tie the legs together with kitchen string and tuck the wing tips under the body of the chicken. Place the onions, carrots, and fennel in a roasting pan. Toss with salt, pepper, 20 sprigs of thyme, and olive oil. Spread around the bottom of the roasting pan and place the chicken on top.
recipes.recipe_description: This roast chicken is a classic dish that is perfect for family dinners. The chicken is seasoned with herbs and spices, and roasted in the oven until crispy and golden brown.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.In separate bowl mix dry ingredients such as garlic powder, oregano, cumin, coriander, thyme and salt. Stir mixture with a fork until all the ingredients are well combined and they form a seasoning. This will be used as a rub to ensure the pork is well seasoned throughout. Sprinkle the rub over the tenderloin with a dry hand, then rub the pork with the seasoning over both sides of the meat, pressing gently so the seasoning adheres well to the tenderloin.
recipes.recipe_description: This pork tenderloin is a delicious and easy meal that is perfect for busy weeknights. The tenderloin is seasoned with spices and roasted in the oven until juicy and tender.

name: Peter Gilmore
description: Peter Gilmore is an Australian chef, known for his innovative and creative approach to cooking.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat one oven to 200C and a second oven to 150C. Turn on an ice cream machine to pre-chill.For the Granita, place sugar and 500ml of water in a medium saucepan and set over medium heat. Bring to a boil, add guava and strawberries, then reduce heat and allow to simmer gently for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to infuse at room temperature, for 30 minutes
recipes.recipe_description: The Snow Egg is one of Peter Gilmore's most famous desserts. It is a delicate meringue shell filled with ice cream, sitting on a bed of custard and topped with a sweet toffee sauce.

recipes.cooking_method: Wash crab. Remove gills and stomach contents. Cut into chunks.Wash rice. Place in soup maker. Add appropriate amount of water. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer to make a thick congee.Add crab chunks to soup maker. Boil over low heat for approximately 40 minutes.Add salt, chicken bouillon, ground pepper, and sesame oil to taste. Sprinkle on celery and serve.
recipes.recipe_description: This Mud Crab Congee is a comforting and hearty dish that is perfect for cold winter nights. The congee is flavored with ginger, garlic and green onions, and topped with succulent pieces of mud crab.

recipes.cooking_method: : Preheat the oven to 375°F. Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings, and place them on a baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Brush the chicken breasts with olive oil and season them with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings. Grill for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F
recipes.recipe_description: The chicken breast is a lean cut of meat taken from the pectoral muscle on the underside of the chicken. Each whole chicken contains one chicken breast with two halves, which are typically separated during the butchering process and sold as individual breast

name: Neil Perry
recipe_description: Neil Perry is one of Australia's leading and most influential chefs. He has managed several award-winning restaurants and has written several cookbooks.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C).In a small bowl, combine the kosher salt, black pepper, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, dried thyme, and cayenne pepper.Rub the spice mixture all over the beef brisket, making sure to coat all sides.In a large Dutch oven or oven-safe pot, combine the beef broth, red wine vinegar,
recipes.recipe_description: This slow-roasted beef brisket recipe is perfect for a weekend feast. The beef is cooked until it's meltingly tender, then served with a rich, flavourful gravy.

ingredients: 2 Barramundi fillets (skin on), about 6 oz each
recipes.cooking_method: Season the Barramundi fillets with salt and pepper on both sides.Coat the fillets in flour, shaking off any excess.Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat.Once the oil is hot, place the Barramundi fillets skin side down into the pan. Cook for 4-5minutes or until the skin is crispy.Carefully flip the fillets over and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the fleshis opaque and cooked through.
recipes.recipe_description: This fresh and light dish is perfect for a quick midweek meal. The barramundi is pan-fried until crispy, then served with a tangy salsa verde.

ingredients: 1 medium pumpkin (about 4 lbs), peeled and cubed
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).Cut the pumpkin in half and remove the seeds and stringy fibers. Cut the pumpkin into small cubes.Place the pumpkin cubes on a baking sheet and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the pumpkin is tender.While the pumpkin is roasting, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
recipes.recipe_description: This spiced pumpkin soup is a comforting and hearty dish, perfect for chilly winter evenings. The pumpkin is roasted with warming spices, then blended to a smooth and creamy texture.

name: Shannon Bennett
description: Shannon Bennett is an award-winning chef, restaurateur, author, and television personality. He has managed several renowned restaurants and is a regular contributor to various culinary publications.

ingredients: 1 medium pumpkin (about 4 lbs), peeled and cubed
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).Cut the pumpkin in half and remove the seeds and stringy fibers. Cut the pumpkin into small cubes.Place the pumpkin cubes on a baking sheet and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the pumpkin is tender.While the pumpkin is roasting, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and sauté for 3-4 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.
recipes.recipe_description: This classic French dish is a hearty and satisfying meal. The beef is slow-cooked in red wine until it's tender and flavourful, then served with buttery mashed potatoes.

recipes.recipe_name: Crispy Skin Salmon with Cauliflower Puree
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper on both sides.Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the cauliflower florets and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender.Drain the cauliflower and transfer it to a blender or food processor.Add the unsalted butter, heavy cream, grated Parmesan cheese, and chopped fresh chives to the blender. Puree the mixture until it is smooth and creamy.Season the cauliflower puree with salt and pepper to taste.
recipes.recipe_description: This elegant dish is perfect for a dinner party. The salmon is pan-seared until the skin is crispy, then served with a creamy cauliflower puree and sautéed greens.

ingredients: 1 pound mixed mushrooms, such as cremini, shiitake, and oyster mushrooms, cleaned an sliced
recipes.cooking_method: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is translucent.Add the sliced mushrooms to the pot and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the mushrooms are browned and tender.Remove the mushrooms from the pot and set aside.Add the Arborio rice to the pot and stir to coat the rice in the oil and onions. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
recipes.recipe_description: This creamy and comforting dish is a favourite for a reason. The risotto is cooked slowly with white wine and stock, then finished with butter, parmesan cheese, and sautéed mushrooms.
